$DATUM 75-08-1

$DATUM 99-61-6

$DATUM 85692-71-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-307-CAS-8811472
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1314-56-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: S,S-Thioacetalization of carbonyl compounds
(general procedure): A mixture of carbonyl compounds (2 mmol), dithiol
(2.2 mmol) or thiol (4.4 mmol) and P2O5/SiO2 (5 mg) was stirred at
ambient temperature. After completion of reaction as checked by TLC, it
was diluted with n-hexane and the catalyst was filtered off. The filtrate
solution (50 ml) was washed with aqueous 10% NaOH (2 x 10 ml) solution
and then dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent was evaporated by
rotary evaporator and the crude product was purified through a column of
silica gel (n-hexane:EtOAc, 80:20) to obtain the pure product. Entry 3d,
yield 91%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, silica support used, reusable catalyst, no
solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Silica gel-supported phosphorus pentoxide: a reusable catalyst for
S,S-acetalization of carbonyl groups under ambient conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Shaterian, Hamid Reza; Azizi, Kobra; Fahimi, Nafiseh
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Sulfur Chemistry (2011), 32(1), 85-91

$DATUM 31-260-CAS-15465284
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 92
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 50450-21-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure To a stirred mixture of
equimolar amounts (1 mmol) of the thiol and the α, β-unsaturated ketone,
(bromodimethyl)sulfonium bromide (5 mol%) (for preparation of the
catalyst refer to G.A. Olah, Y.D. Vankar, M. Arvanghi, G.K. Suryaprakash
Synthesis 720 (1979)) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at room
temperature for 3-5 min. After completion of the reaction as indicated by
TLC, the reaction mixture is diluted with water and extracted with ethyl
acetate. After the usual drying, the organic layers were concentrated and
the product obtained purified by column chromatography (8:2-hexane: ethyl
acetate). Entry: 17; Product: 3hb; Yield 92%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Michael addition, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM (Bromodimethyl)sulfonium bromide mediated Michael addition of thiols to
α,β-unsaturated ketones
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Shailaja, M.; Manjula, A.; Rao, B. Vittal
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Sulfur Chemistry (2007), 28(1), 31-38

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Etherification and Thioetherification of
p-Hydroxybenzyl Alcohols: General Procedure p-Hydroxybenzyl alcohol (1
mmol) and reacting alcohol (or thiol) (3 mmol) was taken in CH2Cl2 (5
mL). NaHSO4•SiO2 (100 mg) was added. The catalyst was prepared from the
readily available ingredients, NaHSO4 and silica gel (finer than 200
mesh), by following the reported method.[5] The reaction mixture was
stirred at room temperature and the reaction was monitored by thin layer
chromatography (TLC). After completion, the mixture was filtered, the
filtrate was concentrated, and the residue was subjected to column
chromatography over silica gel to obtain pure ether (or thioether).
bis-(4-Hydroxybenzyl)-ether (4%-5%) was also obtained while preparing an
ether. Table 2. Entry 15, yield 92%
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry, green chemistry-catalyst, solid-supported catalyst,
silica gel used, other product detected
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Studies on novel synthetic methodologies. Part 31. Silica-supported
sodium hydrogen sulfate-catalyzed facile transformation of
p-hydroxybenzyl alcohols to p-hydroxybenzyl ethers and thioethers
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ramu, R.; Ravindra Nath, N.; Reddy, M. R.; Das, Biswanath
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2004), 34(17), 3135-3145

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM The bromide (666 mg, 1.92 mmol) was then dissolved in DMF (10 ml, 0.2 M)
and allyl mercaptan (156 mg, 2.1 mmol, 1.1 equiv.) was added. The mixture
was cooled to 0 °C and K2CO3 (397 mg, 2.25 mmol, 1.5 equiv.) was added in
one portion. The reaction was stirred for 8 hours at room temperature.
Once TLC indicated the consumption of the starting materials, the mixture
was diluted with EtOAc (100 mL). The organic phase was washed by HCl
solution (1.0 M), saturated NaHCO3 (aq.) and brine and dried over
anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent was put under reduced pressure to give the
crude residue. Flash silica gel chromatography (Ethyl Acetate/Hexane
30:70) was applied to give allyl thioether intermediate. Yield 602 mg,
92%.

$DATUM 7632-00-0

$DATUM 127-09-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 64-17-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-Bromo-2-ethyl-6-methylphenyldiazo-t-butyl sulfide
4-Bromo-2-ethyl-6-methylaniline (7.0 g, 33 mmol) was suspended in 7.8 M
hydrochloric acid (30 mL). The stirred mixture was cooled to -20 °C. and
treated with sodium nitrite (2.27 g, 1.05 equiv.) in water (5 mL),
dropwise over 10 min while the temperature was maintained below -5 °C.
After a further 30 min at -5 °C. to -20 °C., the mixture was buffered to
ca. pH 5 with solid sodium acetate. This mixture (kept at ca. -10 °C.)
was added in portions to a stirred solution of t-butyl thiol (3.7 mL, 1
equiv.) in ethanol (50 mL) at 0 °C. over ca. 10 min. Following addition,
the mixture was stirred at 0 °C. for 30 min and then crushed ice (ca. 50
mL) was added. The mixture was stored in the refrigerator for 2 h. The
resulting light-brown solid was collected by filtration, washed with
water, and dried under high vacuum for several hours (9.47 g, 92%). Mass
spec.: 315.05 (MH)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of diazaheterocycles as calcitonin gene related peptide
receptor antagonists for treating migraine and other conditions

N.; Luo, Guanglin; Macor, John E.; Poindexter, Graham S.; Tora, George O.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM United States, US20070232600 A1 2007-10-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 92
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7647-01-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7632-00-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 127-09-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 64-17-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-Bromo-2-ethyl-6-methylphenyldiazo-t-butyl sulfide
4-Bromo-2-ethyl-6-methylaniline (7.0 g, 33 mmol) was suspended in 7.8 M
hydrochloric acid (30 mL). The stirred mixture was cooled to -20°C and
treated with sodium nitrite (2.27 g, 1. 05 equiv.) in water (5 mL),
dropwise over 10 min while the temperature was maintained below -5°C.
After a further 30 min at -5°C to -20°C, the mixture was buffered to ca.
pH 5 with solid sodium acetate. This mixture (kept at ca.-10°C) was added
in portions to a stirred solution of t-butyl thiol (3.7 mL, 1 equiv.) in
ethanol (50 mL) at 0°C over ca. 10 min. Following addition, the mixture
was stirred at 0°C for 30 min and then crushed ice (ca. 50 mL) was added.
The mixture was stored in the refrigerator for 2 h. The resulting
light-brown solid was collected by filtration, washed with water, and
dried under high vacuum for several hours. (9.47 g, 92%). Mass spec.:
315.05 (MH)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of diazaheterocycles as calcitonin gene related peptide
receptor antagonists
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 4-Bromo-2-ethyl-6-methylphenyldiazo-t-butyl sulfide

hydrochloric acid (30 mL). The stirred mixture was cooled to -20°C. and
treated with sodium nitrite (2.27 g, 1.05 equiv.) in water (5 mL),

hydrochloric acid (30 mL). The stirred mixture was cooled to -20 °C. and

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3a. Procedure for Hf(OTf)4-Catalyzed
Thioacetalization: A mixture of carbonyl compounds (aldehydes or ketones,
1a-v, 1.0 mmol), monothiols (ethanethiol or benzenethiol, 2a-2b, 2.0
mmol) or dithiols (1,2-ethanedithiol or 1,3-propanedithiol, 2c-2d, 1.0
mmol), and a small catalytic amount of hafnium trifluoromethanesulfonate
(Hf(OTf)4, 0.8 mg, 0.001 mmol) in dichloromethane (CH2Cl2, 2 mL) was
stirred at room temperature for 5-240 min. After which the mixture was
filtered through Celite and concentrated under reduced pressure. The
residue was purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel to
afford the corresponding thioacetals 3a-y in high yields. (S)-tert-Butyl
1,1-bis(ethylthio)-3-phenylpropan-2-ylcarbamate (3w): 92% Yield;
colorless solids; mp = 30-31 °C; [α]D 25 -8.1 ° (c = 0.8, CHCl3); 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.319-7.18 (m, 5H), 4.84 (d, 1H, J = 8.1 Hz),
4.26-4.19 (m, 1H), 3.95 (d, 1H, J = 3.0 Hz), 3.20 (dd, 1H, J = 14.1, 5.1
Hz), 2.76-2.61 (m, 5H), 1.36-1.20 (m, 15H); 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3) δ
154.5, 138.1, 129.1, 128.4, 126.4, 77.2, 55.3, 54.8, 37.0, 28.3, 26.3,
14.5; FTIR (film) 2973, 2926, 1703, 1494, 1454, 1391, 1365, 1246, 1165,
1045, 1018, 699 cm-1; MS 355 (M+), 294; HRMS (TOF MS ES+) m/z: Calcd for
C18H29NO2NaS2 [M+Na]+: 378.1537. Found: 378.1543.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure To a stirred mixture of
equimolar amounts (1 mmol) of the thiol and the α, β-unsaturated ketone,
(bromodimethyl)sulfonium bromide (5 mol%) (for preparation of the
catalyst refer to G.A. Olah, Y.D. Vankar, M. Arvanghi, G.K. Suryaprakash
Synthesis 720 (1979)) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at room
temperature for 3-5 min. After completion of the reaction as indicated by
TLC, the reaction mixture is diluted with water and extracted with ethyl
acetate. After the usual drying, the organic layers were concentrated and
the product obtained purified by column chromatography (8:2-hexane: ethyl
acetate). Compound 3ab IR (ν, cm-1): 3015, 2883, 1640, 772, 608; 1H
NMR(δ): 7.46 (d, J = 8 Hz, 2H, Ar), 7.22 (d, J = 7 Hz, 2H, Ar), 6.20 (d,
J = 6 Hz, 1H), 5.29 (d, J = 6 Hz, 1H), 2.40 (m, 2H, S-CH2), 1.24 (t, J =
6 Hz, 1H), 1.08 (t, J = 7 Hz, 3H, CH3); E.I. Mass: 304 (M+); CHN
Analysis: Calcd-C: 66.98, H: 5.62, S: 10.52, Found: C: 65.97, H: 5.56, S:
10.41.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Michael addition, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM (Bromodimethyl)sulfonium bromide mediated Michael addition of thiols to
α,β-unsaturated ketones

$DATUM Shailaja, M.; Manjula, A.; Rao, B. Vittal

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):AMD
$DATUM silica-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Thioacetalization and Transthioacetalization;
General Procedure To a stirred mixture of a carbonyl compound (1 mmol) or
an acetal (1 mmol) and alkyl thiol (2.2 mmol) or ethane dithiol (1.2
mmol) in CH2Cl2 (10 mL), activated NaHSO4·SiO2 (200 mg) was added at r.t.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After completion of
the reaction, the mixture was filtered and the filtrate was concentrated.
The residue was subjected to column chromatography over silica gel and
the column was eluted with EtOAc-hexane (1:4) to afford pure thioacetal.
The spectral and analytical data of the unknown compound are given below.
Compound 2h, yield 92%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Studies on novel synthetic methodologies. Part 39. Simple, mild and
efficient thioacetalization and transthioacetalization of carbonyl
compounds and deprotection of thioacetals: unique role of thiols in the
selectivity of thioacetalization
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Das, Biswanath; Ramu, Ravirala; Reddy, Majjigapu Ravinder; Mahender,
Gurram
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2005), (2), 250-254

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-307-CAS-13670615
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1314-56-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: S,S-Thioacetalization of carbonyl compounds
(general procedure): A mixture of carbonyl compounds (2 mmol), dithiol
(2.2 mmol) or thiol (4.4 mmol) and P2O5/SiO2 (5 mg) was stirred at
ambient temperature. After completion of reaction as checked by TLC, it
was diluted with n-hexane and the catalyst was filtered off. The filtrate
solution (50 ml) was washed with aqueous 10% NaOH (2 x 10 ml) solution
and then dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent was evaporated by
rotary evaporator and the crude product was purified through a column of
silica gel (n-hexane:EtOAc, 80:20) to obtain the pure product. Entry 28d,
yield 91%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, silica support used, reusable catalyst, no
solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Silica gel-supported phosphorus pentoxide: a reusable catalyst for
S,S-acetalization of carbonyl groups under ambient conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Shaterian, Hamid Reza; Azizi, Kobra; Fahimi, Nafiseh
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Sulfur Chemistry (2011), 32(1), 85-91

$DATUM 877773-38-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 108-88-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-Benzyl-3-(t-butylthiomethyl)pyrrolidine-2,5-dione (130e):
Representative procedures for enantioselective protonation reaction of
itaconimide with thiol catalyzed by chiral bicyclic guanidine: 225 microL
(2.00 mmol, 20.0 equiv.) of t-butyl thiol was dissolved in toluene (0.50
mL) in a 4 mL sample vial. Catalyst 7c (2.23 mg, 0.0100 mmol, 0.100
equiv.) was added and the vial was submerged in cryobath at -20 degC.
After being stirred for 10 min, itaconimide 126b (18.7 mg, 0.100 mmol,
1.00 equiv.) was added as solid and stirred for 2 hours. The reaction was
monitored by TLC. Upon completion of the reaction, the reaction mixture
was loaded onto silica gel column. It was purified by gradient elution
(hexane/EtOAc = 25/1 to 2/1) to afford product 130a with a yield of 90 %.
For aromatic thiols, 1.10 equivalents were used instead of 20.0
equivalents. According to the representative procedure, the title
compound was obtained. Colourless liquid; 92 % yield. [alpha 29 D] = +4.5
deg (c = 2.6 in CHCl3).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Chiral Guanidine Catalyzed Enantioselective Protonation Reactions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Leow, Dasheng Jackson
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM (2010), (20140701), No pp.

$DATUM 2-(t-Butylsulfanylmethyl)-1,3-diphenoxy-propan-2-ol 73i: Triethylamine
(0.1 mL, 0.7 mmol) and t-butylthiol (0.11 mL, 1.0 mmol) were added to a
solution of 1,1-di(phenoxymethyl)oxirane 71i (257 mg, 1.0 mmol) in
ethanol, and the resulting mixture was heated to reflux for 2.5 hr. The
reaction mixture was then allowed to cool to rt and the solvent was
removed in vacuo. Purification by column chromatography (SiO2, 2.5 %
EtOAc in petroleum ether) gave the product 73i as a white solid (321 mg,
92 %) mp 68-70 degC.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 52093-27-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1,3-dithiane; Typical
Procedure To a stirred mixture of 4-methoxybenzaldehyde (681 mg, 5 mmol)
and 1,3-propanedithiol (649 mg, 6 mmol) in MeCN (25 mL) was added
Pr(OTf)3 (146 mg, 5 mol%) at r.t. The resulting mixture was stirred at
r.t. for 30 min, then diluted with EtOAc (150 mL), washed with water (60
mL), dried (MgSO4) and concentrated. The residue was chromatographed over
silica gel, eluted with 10% EtOAc in hexane to afford pure
2-(4-methoxyphenyl)-1,3-dithiane. The aqueous layer containing the
catalyst could be evaporated under reduced pressure to give a product.
The IR spectrum of the recovered catalyst was identical to that of the
commercially available catalyst (Aldrich), which could be reused for the
next thioacetalization reaction, without losing any significant activity
(Table 2, entries 2, 3, and 17). Yield 91%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective, green chemistry
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Pr(OTf)3 as an efficient and recyclable catalyst for chemoselective
thioacetalization of aldehydes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM De, Surya Kanta
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2004), (17), 2837-2840

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME37 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 4-Benzyloxybutan-2-one (10a): Representative
Procedure for the Preparation of Michael Adducts 10, 11, and 12.
o-Benzenedisulfonimide (1 5 mol%; 55 mg, 0.25 mmol) was added to a
mixture of benzyl alcohol (2a; 0.5,4 g, 5 mmol) and methyl vinyl ketone
(5 0.36 g, 5 mmol) The mixture was stirred at rt. The reaction was
monitored by gas chromatography (GC) and (GC-mass spectrometry MS) until
the complete disappearance of 2a and 5 (1 h). The reaction mixture was
poured into Et2O-H2O (50 ml, 1:1). The aqueous layer was separated and
extracted with Et2O (2 × 50 ml). The combined organic extracts were
washed with H2O (2 × 50 ml) and dried over Na2SO4 . After solvent removal
under reduced pressure, the crude residue was the virtually pure (GC,
GC-MS, 1H NMR, 13C NMR) afforded compound. The aqueous layer and aqueous
washings were collected and evaporated under reduced pressure. After
removal of the water, virtually pure (1H NMR) o-benzenedisulfonimide (1)
was recovered (49 mg, 89% yield). 4-(n-Butylsulfanyl)butan-2-one (11b).
Pale yellow oil; yield: 91% (0.73 g). Time: 0.5 h. Reactant: 3b. 1H NMR
(200 MHz, CDCl3, 20°C): δ = 0.82 (t, J = 7.3 Hz, 3H), 1.28-1.33 (m, 2H),
1.40-1.48 (m, 2H), 2.08 (s, 3H), 2.38 (t, J = 7.3 Hz, 3H), 2.59-2.65 (m,
4H) ppm. 13C NMR (50 MHz, CDCl3, 20°C): δ = 11.3, 19.4, 22.2, 26.3, 30.2,
30.5, 44.2, 207.8 ppm. MS (EI): m/z (%) = 160 (75) [M+], 117 (42),
71(85), 43 (100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM no solvent, Michael addition
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Hetero-Michael Reactions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Barbero, Margherita; Cadamuro, Silvano; Dughera, Stefano

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis
ofβ-Hydroxy Sulfides 1a-1v. To a mixture of epoxides (5 mmol) and
thiophenols (5 mmol) was added Ga(OTf)3 (0.05 mmol, 1 mol %). The mixture
was stirred at 30 °C for 30 min. The progress of the reaction was
monitored by TLC or HPLC. After completion of the reaction, water was
added and the product was extracted with diethyl ether (3 x 10 mL). The
organic layer was dried (MgSO4) and evaporated, and the crude product was
purified by flash chromatography (ethyl acetate/hexane, 1:15 to 1:5) to
provide the corresponding products. The catalyst in the aqueous phase was
concentrated in vacuo to give a crystalline residue, which was finally
heated at 180 °C for 48 h in vacuo to afford Ga(OTf)3 as colorless
crystal. The recovered Ga(OTf)3 could be reused in the next batch
reaction. 1v, yield 91% Rf = 0.5 (petroleum ether / EtOAc = 4 : 1). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ (ppm) 7.28 – 7.24 (m, 2 H, ArH), 6.96 – 6.89 (m,
2 H, ArH), 4.09 - 4.00 (m, 3 H, CHOH and PhOCH2), 3.26 (br s, 1 H, OH),
2.87 (dd, J = 12.0, 8.0 Hz, 1 H, CH2S), 2.70 (dd, J = 12.0, 8.0 Hz, 1 H,
CH2S), 2.53 (t, J = 8.0 Hz, 2 H, SCH2CH2), 1.58 – 1.52 (m, 2 H, SCH2CH2),
1.40 – 1.35 (m, 2 H), 0.89 (t, J = 8.0 Hz, 2 H, CH3). 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3): δ (ppm) 158.3, 129.5, 121.1, 114.5, 70.2, 68.6, 35.7, 32.2, 31.6,
21.8, 13.6. IR max (neat): 3363, 3008, 2852, 1565, 1448, 1240 cm-1. MS
(ESI) m / z: 241 ([M+1]+, 100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A General and Efficient Method for the Selective Synthesis of β-Hydroxy

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Thioacetalization and Transthioacetalization;
General Procedure To a stirred mixture of a carbonyl compound (1 mmol) or
an acetal (1 mmol) and alkyl thiol (2.2 mmol) or ethane dithiol (1.2
mmol) in CH2Cl2 (10 mL), activated NaHSO4·SiO2 (200 mg) was added at r.t.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After completion of
the reaction, the mixture was filtered and the filtrate was concentrated.
The residue was subjected to column chromatography over silica gel and
the column was eluted with EtOAc-hexane (1:4) to afford pure thioacetal.
The spectral and analytical data of the unknown compound are given below.
Compound 2i, yield 91%.

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Procedure for Aromatic-Aromatic and
Aromatic-Aliphatic Disulfides as Illustrated for Entry 1 in Table 2. To a
stirred solution of 1-chlorobenzotriazole (0.61 g, 4 mmol) and
benzotriazole (0.32 g, 2 0.7 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (30 mL) under N2 at -78 °C
was added dropwise a solution of p-methoxybenzenethiol as R1SH (0.37 g,
2.7 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (2 mL). The solution was allowed to stir for 2 h with
slow warming to -20 °C. 1-Propanethiol as R2SH (0.30 g, 4 mmol) in CH2Cl2
(2 mL) was then added slowly at -20 °C and the solution stirred at 0 °C
for 30 min. The reaction was then quenched with a solution of Na2S2O3
(0.50 g in 10 mL water) together with saturated aqueous NaHCO3 (20 mL),
with rapid stirring at 0 °C for 20 min before being extracted with CH2Cl2
(3 100 mL). The combined organic extracts were dried over anhydrous
MgSO4, filtered, and evaporated under reduced pressure. The crude
material was purified by silica gel column chromatography using light
petroleum/EtOAc mixtures to afford p-methoxyphenyl 1-propyl disulfide
(entry 1, 0.515 g, 2.4 mmol, 89%) as a pale-yellow oil. 1-Hexyl 2-pyridyl
disulfide (entry 8)31. Entry 8 (0.416 g, 91%) was obtained as a yellow
oil. IR (CHCl3): νmax 478 cm-1 (S-S). 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ 0.90 (t,
J = 6.8 Hz, 3H), 1.21-1.43 (m, 6H), 1.69 (quintet, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 2.80
(t, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 7.06 (m, 1H), 7.63 (td, J = 7.5, 2.1 Hz, 1H), 7.73
(d, J = 7.5 Hz, 1H), 8.45 (m, 1H). 13C NMR (75.5 MHz, CDCl3): δ 13.9,
22.5, 28.1, 28.9, 31.3, 39.0, 119.5, 120.4, 136.8, 149.5, 160.7. HRMS:
calcd for C11H17NS2 (M)+, 227.0802; found 227.0815.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry (- reagent)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inexpensive, one-pot synthesis of unsymmetrical disulfides using
1-chlorobenzotriazole
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Hunter, Roger; Caira, Mino; Stellenboom, Nashia
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2006), 71(21), 8268-8271

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure Reactions were carried out
in a test tube (20 mL) under an N2 atmosphere with gentle magnetic
stirring. Phenol (18 mmol), catalyst (2 mmol), paraformaldehyde (0.9 g,
30 mmol), and n-dodecanethiol (4.04 g, 20 mmol) in N,N-dimethylformamide
(4.0 g) was heated at 100-160°C. After completion of the reaction, the
mixture was cooled to room temperature, washed with water, and dried.
Then the yellowish products were analyzed using 1H NMR.
2,6-Di-methyl-4-((dodecylthio)methyl)phenol (white solid), yield 91% mp:
54-55°C 1H NMR (CDCl3): 6.892 (s, 2H, C6H2), 3.573 (s, 2H, PhCH2S), 2.227
(t, 2H, PhCH2SCH2), 1.57-1.519 (m, 2H, SCH2CH2), 1.308 (s, 6H, CH3),
1.232-1.1.170 [m, 18H, (CH2)9], 0.875-0.841 (t, J= 6.8, 3H, CH2CH3).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Catalytic thioalkylation of phenols based on Mannich-type phenol
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Liu, Peng; Zhu, Lunyu; Fang, Yan; Zhang, Huaiping; Chen, Dehong; He, Tao;
Chen, Mingcai; Xu, Kai
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2007), 37(15), 2609-2613

$DATUM 3375-31-3

$DATUM 950982-61-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 110-71-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure for the Coupling of Functionalized Aryl Bromides and
Iodides with Aliphatic and Aromatic Thiols. The appropriate quantity of
stock solution A or B was added to a 4 mL vial containing the aryl
bromide or iodide (1.00 mmol) and LiHMDS or Cs2CO3 (2.4 mmol) as base,
unless otherwise stated, in DME (1.5 mL). The thiol (1.00 mmol) was then
added and the vial was sealed with a cap containing a PTFE septum. The
mixture was heated at the temperature indicated in Tables 6 and 7 until
the aryl halide was consumed, as determined by GC. Silica gel (0.5 g) was
added, and the solvents were evaporated under reduced pressure. The crude
residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel with hexane
or a mixture of hexane and ethyl acetate as eluent. Aryl sulfides were
isolated in the yields reported in Tables 6 and 7. Reactions of
haloarenes bearing aromatic or aliphatic hydroxyl groups and LiHMDS as
base initially form the corresponding sulfide with the hydroxyl group
protected as the silyl ether. However the silyl group was removed by
treatment with acid (1 N HCl) prior to the chromatographic purification.
4-(2-Methyl-2-propylsulfanyl)phenol (Table 6, entries 1 and 4).16 White
solid, yield 91% 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ 7.39 (d, J = 8.5 Hz, 2H), 6.80 (d, J =
8.5 Hz, 2H), 5.62 (bs, 1 H), 1.26 (s, 9H). 13C NMR (CDCl3): δ 156.3,
139.0 (2C), 123.4, 115.5 (2C), 45.6, 30.6 (3C).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM silica gel used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A General, Efficient, and Functional-Group-Tolerant Catalyst System for
the Palladium-Catalyzed Thioetherification of Aryl Bromides and Iodides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Fernandez-Rodriguez, Manuel A.; Hartwig, John F.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(4), 1663-1672

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Epoxide Opening with Thiols A mixture of
epoxide (1 mmol), thiol (1 mmol) and (10 mole%) of (bromodimethyl)
sulfonium bromide was stirred at ambient temperature for an appropriate
time (Table 1). After completion of the reaction, as indicated by TLC,
the reaction mixture was diluted with water and extracted with
dicloromethane, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and concentrated
under reduced pressure and purified by column chromatography to give
corresponding β -hydroxy sulphides. Table 1, yield 91%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM [3-(4-Cyanophenyl)-4,5-dihydroisoxazol-5-yl]thioacetic Acid, S-Isobutyl
Ester (6c). To a solution of THF (189 kg) and 1-propanethiol (24.5 kg,
322 mol) was charged a solution of 2.5 M n-butyllithium in hexane (90.6
L, 226.5 mol) over 130 min at <15 °C. Chlorotrimethylsilane (37.5 kg, 345
mol) was charged over 62 min at 0-15 °C. Nitrogen was sparged through the
solution as the reaction temperature was raised to 30 °C for 6 h to
remove dissolved butane. Heptane (20 kg) was charged to make up for the
volume loss that occurred during the stripping operation, and the
solution was cooled to 20 °C. The slurry was filtered through a Dacron
bag, and cartridge filters in series into a solution of isobutyl
2-[3-(4-cyanophenyl)-4,5-dihydro-5-isoxazolyl]-acetate (5b) (50.0 kg,
96.5 wt %, 168.5 mol) followed by a mixture of THF (22 kg) and heptane
(17 kg). After 10 min, the solution was cooled to e10 °C. Aluminum
chloride (30.0 kg, 225 mol) was charged through a solids charging adapter
over 35 min at e20 °C, followed by heptane (5 kg), and the slurry was
heated to 65 °C over 75 min. After an hour at 65 °C, LC indicated an
6c:5b area ratio of 97.03:0.20. After 110 min, the reaction was cooled to
e20 °C. Water (213 L) and toluene (114 kg) were charged over 1 h at <30
°C. The phases were separated, and the organic layer was washed with
water (2 x 100 L). A final wash was mixed with sodium chloride (14.1 kg)
to aid the separation. The organic phase was reduced in volume by vacuum
distillation at 40-45 °C and 50-75 mmHg vacuum. After 308 kg had been
collected, heptane (256 kg) was charged at 35-40 °C over 68 min to
crystallize 6c. The slurry was cooled to 0-5 °C over 3 h and held 9 h.
The crystals were filtered, and the cake was washed with 0-5 °C heptane
(2 x 51 kg). The crystals were dried at 50 mmHg and 45 °C for 40 h to
yield 44.9 kg (98.6 wt %, 91% yield). This material was identical to that
previously reported.19
[3-(4-Cyanophenyl)-4,5-dihydroisoxazol-5-yl]thioacetic Acid, S-Isobutyl
Ester (6c), yield 44.9 kg (98.6 wt %, 91%).

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Table 2-4 To a solution
of epoxy alcohol (6a-f, 9a-l, 100 mol%) in NaH (0.2-0.5 M) was added
2,6-ditert-buty4-methylpyridine (DTBMP, 20 mol%) followed by Eu(OTf)3 (20
mol%) and the reaction was stirred for a period indicated at the
temperature indicated. The reaction mixture was then cooled to room
temperature and the solvent was removed in vacuo. The residue was
purified by column chromatography (silica gel, AcOEt/Hexane gradient)
gave corresponding products. (2S,3R)-3-Propylsulfanylhexane-1,2-diol
[(+)-12f] Following the general procedure, the reaction of 6a (12.0 mg,
0.104 mmol), DTBMP (4.26 mg, 0.0207 mmol), Eu(OTf)3 (14.6 mg, 0.0207
mmol) and PrSH (0.52 mL) gave 1,2-diol 12f (18.2 mg, 0.0945 mmol, 91%).
[α]D 24 +7.4° (c 0.36, CHCl3) ; IR (neat) : 3389, 2959, 2931, 2872, 1458,
1066 cm-1 ; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ : 3.78-3.63 (m, 3H), 2.74 (dt, J =
8.8, 4.4 Hz, 1H), 2.69 (brs, 1H), 2.59-2.47 (m, 2H), 2.13 (brs, 1H),
1.64-1.57 (m, 4H), 1.50-1.38 (m, 2H), 0.99 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 3H), 0.94 (t,
J = 6.4 Hz, 3H) ; 13C-NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ : 73.3, 64.2, 50.3, 34.4,
33.3, 23.3, 20.5, 13.9, 13.4 ; MS (EI) calculated for C9H20O2S [M]+ :
192.1184, found 192.1199.

$DATUM A solution of 4-chloro-3-nitro-toluene (25 g, 145 mmol) in anhydrous DMF
(200 ml) wastreated with K2CO3 (40.29 g, 291 mmol) and 1-propane thiol
(12.2 g, 160 mmol). The reaction mixture was heated to 70 °C for 12 h.
The reaction mixture was filtered, the filtrate was concentrated under
reduced pressure, diluted water and extracted with ethyl acetate (200
ml). The organic layer was washed with brine, dried over sodium sulphate
and evaporated under reduced pressure, to give a crude which was purified
by column chromatography (silica) using petroleum ether/ethyl acetate as
eluent. 4-methyl-2-nitro-1-(propylthio) benzene as a pale yellow solid,
yield (28 g, 91%). 1H NMR (300MHz, DMSO-d6) δ [ppm] 8.01 (1H,s),
7.37-7.35 (2H, m), 7.28 (1H, m), 2.96-2.89 (2H, m), 2.40 (3H, s),
1.81-1.17 (2H, m), 1.11(1H, s).

$DATUM Intermediate 226: 4-Methyl-2-nitro-1-(propylthio)benzene A solution of
4-chloro-3-nitro-toluene (25 g, 145 mmol) in anhydrous DMF (200 mL) was
treated with K2CO3 (40.29 g, 291 mmol) and 1-propane thiol (12.2 g, 160
mmol). The reaction mixture was heated to 70 °C for 12 h. The reaction
mixture was filtered, the filtrate was concentrated under reduced
pressure, diluted water and extracted with ethyl acetate (200 mL). The
organic layer was washed with brine, dried over sodium sulphate and
evaporated under reduced pressure, to give a crude which was purified by
column chromatography (silica) using petroleum ether/ethyl acetate as
eluent to afford the title compound (28 g, 91%) as a pale yellow solid.
1H NMR (300MHz, DMSO-d6) δ [ppm] 8.01 (s, 1H ), 7.37-7.35(d, 2H, J=
10Hz), 7.29- 7.27(dd, 1H , J= 9.6Hz), 2.96-2.89 (m, 2H), 2.40(s, 3H),
1.81-1.17(m, 2H), 1.11 (s, 1H ).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM The β-hydroxy sulfide was prepared according to the experiment of
Clive.15 1-Methylethyl thiol (3.14 g, 41.3 mmol) was added dropwise to a
solution of sodium (0.950 g, 41.3 mmol) in absolute ethanol (65.0 mL) in
a 100 mL oven-dried round-bottom flask charged with argon and a magnetic
stir bar. The solution was stirred for 15 min, at which time
2-chloroethanol (3.33 g, 41.3 mmol) was added slowly. After the solution
was refluxed for 1 h, the solvent was removed slowly by distillation. The
residue was cooled, and solid NaBr was filtered off to yield 4.5 g of the
desired 2-(1-methylethyl)thioethanol as an oil Isopropyl Vinyl Sulfoxide
(2b). (i) 2-(1-Methylethyl)thioethanol., yield 91% 1H NMR (CDCl3, 300
MHz) δ 3.74-3.64 (m, 2H), 2.98-2.90 (m, 1H), 2.77-2.73 (m, 2H), 1.26 (d,
6H, J = 7.8 Hz).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reactions of tetrachlorophthalonitrile with
thiols (general procedure). Tetrachlorophthalonitrile (I), 1.33 g, and a
required amount (0.005, 0.010, 0.015, or 0.020 mol) of the corresponding
thiol were dispersed in 20 ml of DMF, and an equimolar amount of
triethylamine (with respect to the thiol) was added dropwise under
stirring at room temperature. The mixture gradually turned brown, and a
white solid separated. The mixture was stirred for 1 h, poured into 5%
hydrochloric acid, and extracted with benzene (or the precipitate was
filtered off and dissolved in benzene), and the products were separated
by column chromatography on silica gel using benzene as eluent or were
purified by recrystallization. Compound X. Yellow viscous oil. Yield:
91%. 13C NMR spectrum, (In DMSO-d6), δC, ppm: 149.1 (CAr-S), 140.8
(CAr-Cl), 117.3 (CAr-CN), 114.1 (C≡N), 36.9 (CH2-S), 32.0 (CH2), 22.0
(CH2), 14.1 (CH3). 1H NMR spectrum, (In DMSO-d6), δ, ppm: 0.88 t (6H),
1.30-1.54 m (8H), 3.10 t (4H). IR spectra: (2234, νCN cm-1). Found, %, C:
51.51, 51.60, H: 4.84, 4.95, Cl: 18.91, 19.02, N: 7.52, 7.60, S: 17.03,
17.14, Formula: C16H18Cl2N2S2. Calculated, %, C: 51.47, H: 4.86, Cl:
18.99, N: 7.50, S: 17.18, M+: 372.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of
7-Alkylsulfanyl-5-nitroquinazoline-4(3H)-ones 9a-c (General Procedure). A
suspension of 5,7-dinitroquinazolinone 4 or 5 (1.50 mmol), a
corresponding alkanethiol (1.52 mmol), and K2CO3 (0.31 g, 2.27 mmol) in
DMF (7 mL) is stirred for 40 min at rt. The mixture is poured into water
(100 mL) and acidified to pH 3. The precipitate is filtered off and
washed with water.
7-Butylsulfanyl-2,3-dimethyl-5-nitroquinazoline-4(3H)-one (9b). Yield:
91%, mp 162-164 °C. 1H NMR (DMSO-d6, δ): 0.90 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 3H), 1.44
(m, 2H), 1.63 (m, 2H), 2.58 (s, 3H), 3.17 (t, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 3.46 (s,
3H), 7.55 (s, 1H), 7.76 (s, 1H). EI-MS (70 eV) (m/z , I, %): 307 [M+,
60], 260 [36], 251 [83], 221 [74], 205 [62], 193 [65], 56 [100]. Anal.
Calcd for C14H17N3O3S: C, 54.71; H, 5.57; N, 13.67; S, 10.43. Found: C,
54.36; H, 5.69; N, 13.51; S, 10.58.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthetic Utilization of Polynitroaromatic Compounds. 6. Remarkable
Regioselectivity in Nucleophilic Displacement of Aromatic Nitro Groups
with Amines
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of [Li(thf)4][1]. A solution of EtSH (0.13 mL, 1.7 mmol) in THF
(5 mL) was added drop-wise to a solution of
[{(Me3Si)2N}3Gd(μ-Cl)Li(thf)3] (1.51 g, 1.7 mmol) in THF (20 mL) at room
temperature. After stirring for 4 hours, the THF was removed in vacuo.
Toluene (20 mL) was then added and the mixture brought to reflux, before
being filtered to give a colourless solution. Colourless crystals of
[Li(thf)4][1] were obtained after storing the solution at 4°C for 2 days.
Removing the nascent solvent, washing the crystals with a small amount of
pentane followed by drying in vacuo resulted in [Li(thf)4][1] being
isolated as a polycrystalline material Colourless polycrystalline, (0.38
g, 91%). Elemental analysis calculated for C58H149N4Gd4S9Si8O4: C 33.03,
H 7.12, N 2.66; found: C 33.28, H 7.04, N 2.57. Formula
Gd4S9Si8O4N4LiC58H149 FW 2188.12 Crystal system monoclinic Space group
P21/c a/A 14.8584(5), b/A 25.4645(8), c/A 26.6088(10), α/° 90, β/°
91.664(3), γ/° 90 V/A3 10063.5(6) Z 4.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3. General reaction procedure for asymmetric
1,4-conjugate addition with 4f To a solution of 5 (0.2 mmol) and catalyst
QD-4f (15.0 or 30.0 mg, 0.02 or 0.04 mmol) in chloroform (0.4 mL) was
added thiol 6 (0.6mmol, 3 equiv.). The reaction mixture was kept at -20°C
or -50°C for 72 h, and then was filtered through a short plug of silica
gel. The silica gel plug was washed with diethyl ether (5.0 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated in vacuo, and the residue was subjected to
flash chromatography (SiO2) to give product 7.
3-(3-(benzylthio)butanoyl)oxazolidin-2-one
3-(3-(allylthio)-3-(2-bromophenyl)propanoyl)oxazolidin-2-one The crude
product was purified by by flash chromatography (SiO2, hexanes/ethyl
acetate = 2/1) to give compound 7u as a colorless oil in 91% yield and
96% ee [determined by HPLC, chiral OD, hexanes: isopropanol = 80:20, 1.0
mL/min, λ = 220 nm, t (major) = 25.3 min, t (minor) = 20.4 min]. [α]D 25
= +51.8 (c 0.5, CHCl3); 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 3.05-3.16 (m, 2H),
3.34-3.40 (m, 1H), 3.64-3.70 (m, 1H), 3.93-4.03 (m, 2H), 4.35-4.44 (m,
2H), 4.94 (t, J= 5.4 Hz, 1H), 5.06-5.12 (m, 2H), 5.74-5.84 (m, 1H),
7.08-7.12 (m, 1H), 7.30-7.34 (m, 1H), 7.52-7.54 (m, 1H), 7.60-7.62 (m,
1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, MeOH) δ 34.80, 41.37, 42.46, 42.84, 62.16, 117.63,
124.11, 127.90, 128.75, 129.46, 132.86, 133.80, 140.55, 153.44, 169.86;
HRMS (CI/[M+Na+MeOH]+) Calcd. for: C16H20O4NBrNaS: 424.0194. Found:
424.0186.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Thia-Michael Addition of
Thiols to Nitroolefins Thiol (0.55 mmol) was added to a mixture of
nitroolefin (0.5 mmol) in water (5 mL), and the mixture was vigorously
stirred at room temperature until the nitro olefin was consumed
completely (5 min). The reaction mixture was extracted with EtOAc (5 mL x
3), and the combined organic phase was washed with saturated Na2CO3
solution (15 mL x 3) and brine (15 mL x 3), dried over anhydrous MgSO4,
and concentrated under reduced pressure to give the crude product. The
crude product was purified by flash-column chromatography to afford
desired β -nitro sulfides. (2-Nitro-1-p-tolylethyl) (pentyl) Sulfide
(3e). Yellowish oil, yield 91%. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 0.87 (t, J =
6.9 Hz, 3H, CH3), 1.27-1.32 (m, 4H, CH2), 1.51-1.56 (m, 2H, CH2), 2.33
(s, 3H, CH3), 2.43 (t, J = 7.2Hz, 2H, CH2), 4.52 (t, J = 8.1 Hz, 1H, CH),
4.73 (d, J = 8.1Hz, 2H, CH2), 7.15 (d, J = 8.1 Hz, 2H, ArH), 7.22 (d, J =
8.1 Hz, 2H, ArH). 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 138.17, 134.29, 129.61,
127.42, 79.37, 46.23, 31.54, 30.82, 28.77, 22.12, 21.07, 13.85. Anal.
calcd. for C14H21NO2S: C, 62.89; H, 7.92; N, 5.24. Found: C, 62.70; H,
7.71; N, 5.12.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-solvent, green chemistry-waste reduction, thia-Michael
addition reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Green procedure for the synthesis of β-nitro sulfides by Michael addition
of thiols to nitroolefins
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Hui, Xin-Ping; Yin, Chao; Ma, Jun; Xu, Peng-Fei
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2009), 39(4), 676-690

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: (Z)-Dec-1-ene-1,2-diylbis(p-tolylsiilfane)
(3a); Typical Procedure (2)-(1-Bromodec-1-en-2-yl)(p-tolyl)sulfane (1a)
(171 mg, 0.5 mmol) was added to a stirred solution of 4-toluenethiol (2a)
(70 mg, 0.75 mmol), Cu2O (7 mg, 0.05 mmol), DMEDA (8 μL, 0.075 mmol),
Cs2CO3 (326 mg, 1 mmol) in DMF (2 mL) under N2. The resulting mixture was
stirred at 120 °C for 24 h. After being cooled to r.t., the mixture was
diluted with H2O (15 mL) and extracted with EtOAc (3 × 15 mL). The
combined organic layer was dried over Na2SO4 and concentrated. The crude
residue was purified by flash column chromatography (eluent: PE-EtOAc,
50:1). (Z)-Octyl[2-(p-tolylthio)dec-1-en-1-yl]sulfane (3v). Light yellow
oil; yield: 185 mg (91%). Reactant: (Z)-2-Bromovinyl sulfide 1a and
Aromatic thiol 2k. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.19 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2
H), 7.04 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2 H), 6.24 (s, 1 H), 2.69 (t, J = 7.4 Hz, 2 H),
2.28 (s, 3 H), 2.13 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 2 H), 1.66-1.59 (m, 2 H), 1.44-1.36
(m, 4 H), 1.25 (br m, 10 H), 1.18 (br m, 8 H), 0.88-0.83 (m, 6 H). 13C
NMR (100 MHZ, CDCl3): δ= 136.3, 131.5, 130.5, 130.2, 129.5, 37.0, 34.0,
31.8, 31.7, 30.4, 29.2, 29.1, 28.7, 28.6, 28.4, 22.6, 21.0, 14.0. HRMS
(TOF): m/z calcd for C25H42S2: 406.2728; found: 406.2731.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure: To a stirred mixture of
tri-O-acetyl-D-glucal 1 (1 mmol) and the acceptor (1.1 mmol) in
dichloromethane, was added Yb(OTf)3 (0.1 mmol, 10 mol%) at ambient
temperature. The mixture was stirred for the required time (Table 1) and
the reaction monitored by TLC. Water (20 mL) was added to the reaction
mixture and extracted 2 times with dichloromethane. The combined organic
layers were dried over anhydrous sodium sulphate, filtered and
concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography to
furnish the products. (23) 1bα Table 1 Glycosidation of 1 with alcohols
and thiols in the presence of 10 mol% of Yb(OTf)3 The versatility of this
protocol was further illustrated by making thioglycosides 13b and 14b
with 1-octanethiol (entry 13, Table 1) and thiophenol (entry 14, Table
1). Entry 13 Compound 13b Yield 91%, α:β 9:1.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1643-19-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Phthalonitriles 2; General Procedure According to the conditions
described in Tables 1 and 2, phthalonitriles 1a-e (500 mg) were treated
with thiols, alcohols, or 1-bromoheptane (and K2CO3) in molten Bu4NBr.
After cooling, the mixtures were extracted with Et2O (3 × 25 mL) and the
ionic liquid could be recovered by filtration and re-used after washing
extensively with Et2O. The combined Et2O extracts were rotary-evaporated
and the crude products were purified either by column chromatography or
recrystallization. A larger quantity of 1b (1 g) reacted with
1-octanethiol giving 2c, while 1c (1 g) reacted with phenol affording 2i.
3-Octylthiophthalonitrile (2c)17c. Yield 91%. 1H NMR: δ = 7.52-7.63 (m, 3
H, ArH), 3.05 (t, J= 7.5 Hz, 2 H, SCH2), 1.71 (quintet, J = 7.5 Hz, 2 H,
CH2), 1.41-1.50 (m, 2 H, CH2), 1.22-1.32 (m, 8 H, CH2), 0.88 (t, J = 6.9
Hz, 3 H, CH3). MS (EI): m/z = 272 (33, [M+]), 160 (79), 71 (83), 57
(100). HRMS (EI): m/z calcd for C16H20N2S: 272.1342; found: 272.1337.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Ionic liquid
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Phthalocyanine synthesis in ionic liquids: Preparation of differently
substituted phthalocyanines in tetrabutylammonium bromide
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Lo, Pui-Chi; Cheng, Diana Y. Y.; Ng, Dennis K. P.

$DATUM 11, yield 91%. Ultimately, we could take advantage of the ready removal
of the thiazolidinethione-like chiral auxiliary. For instance, α
-C-glycoside 3f was converted into thioester 11, and the addition of
carbon nucleophiles afforded β -keto phosphonate 12 and β -keto ester 13
under very mild conditions (Scheme 2).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Using an established procedure 1 a solution of
carboxylic acid (5 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (25 mL) was treated with isobutyl
chloroformate (816 mg, 6.0 mmol) and Et3N (505 mg, 5 mmol). After
stirring for 30 minutes at room temperature, 1-dodecanethiol (1.11 g, 5.5
mmol), Et3N (505 mg, 1.0 equiv.), and DMAP (31 mg, 0.25 mmol) were added
successively and the resulting mixture stirred for 70 minutes at room
temperature. The reaction was quenched by addition of H2O (25 mL) and
extracted with ethyl acetate (2 × 50 mL). Combined organic phase was
washed with brine and dried with MgSO4. Purification by flash column
chromatography on silica gel or recrystallizations in hexanes or
EtOAc/hexanes (2 : 98 v/v). S-Dodecyl
(S)-2-(((benzyloxy)carbonyl)amino)-3-phenylpropanethioate (1a)3 .
Following the general procedure A and purification by column
chromatography over silica gel column (CHCl3/hexanes, 1:1 v/v). S-Dodecyl
cyclopent-1-enecarbothioate (1k). Following the general procedure A and
purification by column chromatography over silica gel column (3:97, v/v
EtOAc : hexanes) gave the title compound 1k as a colourless oil (2.0 g,
91%). Rf 0.68 (1:4, v/v EtOAc : hexane); 1H-NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ
6.80-6.78 (m, 1H), 2.92 (t, J= 7.4 Hz, 2H), 2.65-2.59 (m, 2H), 2.54-2.48
(m, 2H), 2.00-1.92 (m, 2H), 1.72-1.46 (m, 2H), 1.40-1.25 (m, 18H), 0.88
(t, J= 7.0 Hz, 3H); 13C-NMR (101 MHz, CDCl3) ) δ 189.0, 144.1, 141.4,
33.3, 31.9, 31.2, 29.6, 29.6, 29.6, 29.5, 29.4, 29.3, 29.1, 28.9, 28.4,
22.9, 22.6, 14.0; IR νmax 2920, 2851, 1655, 1461, 1153, 894, 789; HRMS
Found (M + Na)+ 319.2071, C18H32OS requires (M + Na)+ 319.2072.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Thus, a reaction mixture containing acid
chloride (1 mmol) and 1-dodecanethiol (242 mg, 1.2 mmol) in THF (5 mL)
was passed through the column of dried Amberlyst A 21 using a Vapourtec
R4/R2 or E2 flow system at room temperature with residence time of 60
min, flow rate 23 μL/min. The solution from the outlet (25 mL) was
concentrated at reduced pressure and the residue purified by
recrystallization from hexanes or chromatographed over silica gel column
using solvents as specified. S-Dodecyl 3-phenylprop-2-enethioate (1i).
Following the general procedure B and recrystallization in hexanes at 0
°C gave the title compound 1i as a white crystalline solid (3.0 g, 91%).
Rf 0.58 (1:4, v/v EtOAc : hexane); Mp 45-47 °C (lit. 49 °C).4 1H-NMR (400
MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.60 (d, J= 16.0 Hz, 1H), 7.57-7.50 (m, 2H), 7.42-7.34 (m,
3H), 6.71 (d, J= 16.0 Hz, 1H), 3.00 (t, J= 7.4 Hz, 2H), 1.64 (p, J= 7.4
Hz, 2H), 1.42-1.26 (m, 18H ), 0.88 (t, J= 7.0 Hz, 3H). 13C-NMR (101 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 190.0, 140.1, 134.2, 130.4, 128.9, 128.3, 125.2, 77.3, 77.0,
76.7, 31.9, 29.6, 29.6, 29.6, 29.5, 29.3, 29.1, 29.0, 28.9, 22.7, 14.1;
IR νmax 2916, 2850, 1652, 1607, 1041, 987, 777, 756, 693.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for Table 2: A 4 mL vial
sealed equipped with a magnetic stirrer bar was charged with KOH (56.0
mg, 1.0 mmol), Cu2 O (0.35 mg, 0.0025 mmol) and vinyl iodide (0.6 mmol)
in dioxane (0.25 mL). The aliphatic thiol or aromatic thiol (0.5 mmol)
was added via syringe, and the vial was sealed with a cap containing a
PTFE septum and the reaction vessel was heated at 110 °C in an oil bath.
After stirring at this temperature for 12 h, the heterogeneous mixture
was cooled to room temperature and diluted with ethyl acetate (20 mL).
The resulting solution was directly filtered through a pad of celite then
washed with ethyl acetate (20 mL) and concentrated to give the crude
material which was then purified by column chromatography (SiO2, hexane
and CH2Cl2 or ethyl acetate) to yield Table2. Following the general
procedure for Table 2, using iodomethylenecyclohexane (133.0 mg, 0.6
mmol), cyclohexanethiol (0.0615 mL, 0.5 mmol), then purified by column
chromatography (SiO2, hexane). Following the general procedure for Table
2, using iodomethylenecyclohexane (133.0 mg, 0.6 mmol), 1-dodecanethiol
(0.120 mL, 0.5 mmol), then purified by column chromatography (SiO2,
hexane). (Cyclohexylidenemethyl)(dodecyl)sulfane (3d), colorless oil (135
mg, 91% yield). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 0.88 (t, J= 6.8 Hz, 3 H),
1.26-1.51 (m, 24 H), 1.53-1.62 (m, 2 H), 2.13-2.14 (m, 2 H), 2.24-2.26
(m, 2 H), 2.60 (t, J= 7.6 Hz, 2 H), 5.57 (s, 1 H); 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3):δ = 14.1, 22.7, 26.4, 27.0, 28.2, 28.6, 29.2, 29.3, 29.5, 29.61,
29.63, 30.1, 30.3, 31.9, 34.0, 36.4, 115.0, 141.9; HREI-MS calcd. for C19
H36S: 296.2538, Found: 296.2542.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: As a typical procedure, MPC (10 mmol) and
1-alkanethiol (10 mmol) were mixed together in ethanol (20 mL) after
which Ar gas bubbling was performed for 15 min. Diisopropylamine (DIPA: 4
mol %) was added to the solution as a catalyst. After stirring for 20 h
at room temperature, ethanol was evaporated under vacuum, and the residue
was washed with hexane to remove nonreacted 1-alkanethiol compounds. The
products were extracted by tetrahydrofuran (THF) or acetone to remove the
unreacted MPC, and then, the solvent was evaporated under vacuum.
Finally, the samples were freeze-dried. The structure of products was
characterized by 1H NMR (300 MHz NMR spectrometer: JEOL Ltd., Tokyo,
Japan) and FT-IR spectroscopy (JASCO, Co., Tokyo, Japan). C12-S-PC: yield
90.6% 1H NMR (CD3OD, 300 MHz): δ = 0.87-0.91 (CH3CH2CH2-, 3H), 1.21-1.37
(-CH(CH3)C(=O) and CH3(CH2)9CH2-, 21H), 1.51-1.58 (-CH2CH2CH2S-, 2H),
2.49-2.83 (-CH2CH2SCH2CH(CH3)-, 5H), 3.22 (-N(CH3), 9H), 3.61-3.64
(-CH2N, 2H), 4.03-4.09 (POCH2-, 2H), and 4.24-4.29 (OCH2CH2OP,
4H).FT-IR(KBr, cm-1): 2955, 2925, 2854 (C-H), 1732 (C=O), 1248 (P=O),
1085 (-OPOCH2-), 967 (-N+ (CH3)3-).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, Michael addition
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 15956-28-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 71-43-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
1-[2-Oxo-3-(prop-2-en-1-yloxy)piperidin-1-yl]butane-1,3-dione (5a);
Typical Procedure N-Substituted diazo compound 2a (40 mg, 3.2 mmol) and
allyl alcohol 4a (18 mg, 3.2 mmol) were dissolved in anhydrous benzene
(20 mL) and stirred for 5 min at r.t. To this stirred solution was added
Rh2(OAc)4 (1 mol%) and the resulting mixture was stirred at 60°C for 2 h.
After cooling, the mixture was concentrated under reduced pressure.
Purification of the residue by column chromatography on silica gel.
2-Diazo-1-[2-oxo-3-(prop-2-en-1-ylsulfanyl)piperidin-1-yl]butane-1,3-dione
(6e) Yield: 253 mg (91%); yellow oil. IR (ATR): 2095, 1723, 1687, 1638,
1385, 1351, 1316, 1269, 1152, 931 cm-1. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ =
5.74-5.69 (m, 1 H, CH), 5.22-5.12 (m, 2 H, CH2), 3.62-3.60 (m, 2 H, CH),
3.40-3.33 (m, 2 H, CH), 3.19 (dd, J1 = 5.8 Hz, J2 = 1.8 Hz, 1 H, CH2),
2.43 (s, 3 H, CH3), 2.16-2.13 (m, 1 H, CH2), 1.99-1.82 (m, 3 H, CH2). 13C
NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 201.4 (C=O), 173.2 (C=O), 168.7 (NC=O), 134.0
(=CH), 117.9 (=CH2), 75.9 (SCH), 71.7 (SCH2), 54.3 (C=N2), 41.7 (CH2),

$DATUM ABCDE S,O-Acetal 38. To a stirred solution of ABDE ketone 37 (427 mg,
0.29 mmol, 1.0 equiv) in CH2Cl2:EtSH (5:1, 30 mL) at 25 °C was added
Zn(OTf)2 (529 mg, 1.45 mmol, 5.0 equiv), and the reaction mixture was
stirred at 25 °C for 20 h. The resulting mixture was quenched by the
addition of Et3N (2 mL), and concentrated to afford the corresponding
S,O-acetal diol, which was carried on crude. To a stirred solution of the
crude diol in CH2Cl2 (15 mL) 25 °C were added imidazole (396 mg, 5.82
mmol, 20 equiv) and TESCl (488 μL, 2.91 mmol, 10.0 equiv), and the
reaction mixture was stirred at 25 °C for 1 h. The reaction mixture was
quenched with sat. aq. NH4Cl (20 mL), the resulting biphasic mixture was
extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 × 15 mL), and the combined organic layers were
dried (MgSO4) and concentrated. Flash column chromatography (silica gel,
hexanes:EtOAc 97:3 to 9:1) gave ABCDE S,O-acetal 38 (367 mg, 0.27 mmol,
91% yield over the two steps) as a pale yellow oil. 38, yield (367 mg,
0.27 mmol, 91% over the two steps) Rf = 0.35 (silica gel, hexanes:EtOAc
9:1); [α]D32 = +40.4 (CH2Cl2, c = 0.74); IR (film) νmax 2946, 2911, 2875,
1454, 1249, 1085, 1028, 840, 734, 697 cm-1; 1H NMR (600 MHz, C6D6): δ =
7.66-7.65 (m, 2 H), 7.51-7.50 (m, 2 H), 7.43-7.38 (m, 4 H), 7.28-7.27 (m,
4 H), 7.24-7.17 (m, 10 H), 7.13-7.02 (m, 8 H), 5.30 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 1
H), 5.24 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 1 H), 4.84 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 1 H), 4.81 (d, J =
12.0 Hz, 1 H), 4.66 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 1 H), 4.62 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 1 H),
4.54 (d, J = 12.0 Hz, 1 H), 4.48 (d, J = 9.6 Hz, 1 H), 4.43-4.34 (m, 4
H), 4.32 (dd, J = 9.6, 1.8 Hz, 1 H), 4.19 (t, J = 1.2 Hz, 1 H), 4.14 (d,
J = 11.4 Hz, 1 H), 4.10 (dt, J = 9.6, 1.2 Hz, 1 H), 4.02-3.97 (m, 2 H),
3.83 (dd, J = 9.6, 1.8 Hz, 1 H), 3.77-3.74 (m, 3 H), 3.64 (dd, J = 9.6,
7.8 Hz, 1 H), 3.55 (q, J = 9.0 Hz, 2 H), 3.46 (t, J = 7.8 Hz, 1 H), 3.26
(dd, J = 7.2, 1.8 Hz, 1 H), 3.20 (d, J = 10.2 Hz, 1 H), 2.94 (ddd, J =
12.0, 9.6, 4.2 Hz, 1 H), 2.65-2.59 (m, 1 H), 2.47-2.40 (m, 2 H), 2.37
(dd, J = 15.6, 2.4 Hz, 1 H), 2.28-2.24 (m, 3 H), 2.15 (dt, J = 9.0, 4.8
Hz, 1 H), 2.11 (dd, J = 11.4, 4.8 Hz, 1 H), 1.79-1.75 (m, 2 H), 1.23 (s,
3 H), 1.11 (t, J = 7.8 Hz, 3 H), 1.07 (t, J = 7.8 Hz, 9 H), 1.04 (d, J =

127.52, 127.50, 127.4, 93.5, 85.6, 80.6, 78.6, 78.3, 77.4, 76.83, 76.76,

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3. General reaction procedure for asymmetric
1,4-conjugate addition with 4f To a solution of 5 (0.2 mmol) and catalyst
QD-4f (15.0 or 30.0 mg, 0.02 or 0.04 mmol) in chloroform (0.4 mL) was
added thiol 6 (0.6mmol, 3 equiv.). The reaction mixture was kept at -20°C
or -50°C for 72 h, and then was filtered through a short plug of silica
gel. The silica gel plug was washed with diethyl ether (5.0 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated in vacuo, and the residue was subjected to
flash chromatography (SiO2) to give product 7.
3-(3-(benzylthio)butanoyl)oxazolidin-2-one
3-(3-(isobutylthio)butanoyl)oxazolidin-2-one The crude product was
purified by flash chromatography (SiO2, hexanes/ethyl acetate = 2/1) to
give compound 7h as a colorless oil in 91% yield and 90% ee [determined
by HPLC, chiral AD, hexanes: isopropanol = 90:10, 1.0 mL/min, λ = 220 nm,
t (major) = 12.8 min, t (minor) =13.7 min]. [α]D 25 = - 4.2 (c 0.5,
CHCl3); 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 0.98 (d,J= 5.1 Hz, 6H), 1.35 (d,J= 5.1
Hz, 3H), 1.76-1.83 (m, 1H), 2.46 (d,J = 5.1 Hz, 2H), 3.01-3.06 (m, 1H),
3.27-3.36 (m, 2H), 4.04 (t,J = 6.0 Hz, 2H), 4.23 (t,J = 6.0 Hz, 2H); 13C
NMR (100 MHz, MeOH) δ 21.67, 22.07, 28.72, 35.95, 39.58, 42.49, 42.58,
62.05, 153.41, 171.22; HRMS (CI/[M+Na+MeOH]+) Calcd. for: C12H23NO4SNa:
300.1245. Found: 300.1247.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical experimental procedure for the
formation of primary allylic sulfides 3: benzenethiol (4a) (0.99 M in
DMF, 0.36 mL, 0.36 mmol) was added to a flask charged with sodium hydride
(55 wt% in mineral oil, 16 mg, 0.36 mmol) under argon and the mixture was
stirred for 10 min at room temperature. Tetrakis(triethyl
phosphite)nickel(0) (1) (11 mg, 0.015 mmol), THF (1.2 mL), and a DMF (0.3
mL) solution of (E)-3-phenyl-2-propenyl acetate (2a) (53 mg, 0.3 mmol)
were successively added to the mixture, which was refluxed for 20 h. The
reaction was quenched by addition of 1M NaOH and organic materials were
extracted with ether. The organic layer was washed with 1M NaOH and dried
over Na2SO4. The solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure and the
residue was purified by PTLC (hexane) to afford 3a (65 mg, 96%). When
alkanethiols were used instead of benzenethiol, the reaction was carried
out at 50 °C for 20 h and quenched by addition of 1M KOH.
(E)-1-(Ethylthio)-5-phenylpent-2-ene (3f). IR (neat) 3027, 2925, 2854,
1496, 1454, 1265, 1198, 966, 698; 1H NMR 1.20 (t, J = 7.4 Hz, 3H),
2.41-2.49 (m, 4H), 2.70 (t, J = 7.7 Hz, 2H), 3.09 (d, J = 6.8 Hz, 2H),
5.44 (dt, J = 15.2, 6.8 Hz, 1H), 5.54 (dt, J = 15.2, 6.1 Hz, 1H),
7.12-7.33 (m, 5H); 13C NMR 14.5, 24.4, 33.3, 34.0, 35.8, 125.8, 126.8,
128.3, 128.4, 132.3, 141.7. Anal. Calcd for C13H18S: C, 75.67; H, 8.79.
Found: C, 75.52; H, 9.14.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Procedure for the synthesis of α,β-unsaturated thioesters from acyl
chlorides (Procedure C)3 The acyl chloride (5.0 mmol) and ethanethiol
(370 μL, 5.0 mmol) were dissolved in hexane (10 mL) and the mixture was
cooled to 0 °C. A solution of triethylamine (762 μL, 5.5 mmol) in hexane
(3 mL) was added dropwise within 30 min to the magnetically stirred
reaction mixture. The reaction mixture was stirred overnight and allowed
to reach rt. The white precipitate was filtered and washed with a 1:1
mixture of n-hexane and Et2O. The filtrate was evaporated under reduced
pressure and purified by flash chromatography to give the corresponding
thioester. (E)-Thiohex-2-ene-oic acid (S)-ethyl ester (1d): Thioester
1dwas obtained from (E)-hex-2-enoic acid following the general procedure
B described above, after purification by flash chromatography (eluent
pentane/Et2O 70:1), as a colorless liquid (91% yield). 1H-NMR (200 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 0.89 (t, J = 7.4 Hz, 3H), 1.23 (t, J = 7.4 Hz, 3H), 1.45
(sextet, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 2.13 (dq, J = 7.0 and 1.4 Hz, 2H), 2.89 (q, J =
7.4 Hz, 2H), 6.06 (dt, J = 15.6 and 1.2 Hz, 1H), 6.84 (dt, J = 15.6 and
6.8 Hz, 1H). 13C-NMR (50.3 MHz, CDCl3) δ 13.5, 14.7, 21.2, 22.9, 34.0,
128.7, 144.9, 189.9. LRMS (CI) m/z : 158(M+), 129 (M+-CH2CH3), 97(100),
55; HRMS calcd for C8H14OS (M+): 158.0765; found: 158.0771.s

$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 157141-27-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 12125-02-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
(3S,5R,6S)-3-Ally5-(3-chlorophenyl)-6-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-methy1-((S)-1-(((trimethylsilyl)methyl)thio)butan-2-yl)-piperidin-2-one
(60). To a solution of 55 (125 mg, 0.280 mmol) in toluene (1 mL) was
added cyanomethylenetributylphosphorane (300 μL, 1.12 mmol) and
(trimethylsilyl)methanethiol (150 μL 1.12 mol) at 25 °C. The mixture was
heated to 110 °C for 2 h. The reaction was cooled down to rt, quenched
(satd NH4Cl), extracted (2 x EtOAc), and washed (brine). The combined
organic layers were dried over Na2SO4 and filtered, and the filtrate was
concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash
column chromatography (SiO2, 10, 20, 40% EtOAc/hexanes) to provide 60.
Compounds 26, 28−33, 35, 38, and 40, were prepared from 55−57, and 61−64,
respectively, according to a similar procedure described for the
synthesis of 20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
(3S,5R,6S)-3-Ally5-(3-chlorophenyl)-6-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-methy1-((S)-1-(((trimethylsilyl)methyl)thio)butan-2-yl)-piperidin-2-one
(60). To a solution of 55 (125 mg, 0.280 mmol) in toluene (1 mL) was
added cyanomethylenetributylphosphorane (300 μL, 1.12 mmol) and
(trimethylsilyl)methanethiol (150 μL 1.12 mol) at 25 °C. The mixture was
heated to 110 °C for 2 h. The reaction was cooled down to rt, quenched
(satd NH4Cl), extracted (2 x EtOAc), and washed (brine). The combined
organic layers were dried over Na2SO4 and filtered, and the filtrate was
concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash
column chromatography (SiO2, 10, 20, 40% EtOAc/hexanes) to provide 60.
Compounds 26, 28−33, 35, 38, and 40, were prepared from 55−57, and 61−64,
respectively, according to a similar procedure described for the
synthesis of 20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Mitsunobu reaction

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-(tert-butylthio)but-2-yn-1-ol. To a stirred solution of
4-hydroxybut-2-ynyl 4- methylbenzenesulfonate4 (1.44 g, 6.0 mmol) in MeOH
(7 mL) and H2O (7 mL) was added K2CO3 (870 mg, 6.30 mmol, 1.05 equiv.)
and 2-methylpropane-2-thiol (710 μL, 6.30 mmol, 1.05 equiv.) and the
resulting solution stirred overnight at room temperature. The reaction
mixture was diluted with saturated aqueous NaCl (15 mL) and extracted
with EtOAc (3 × 15 mL). The combined organic extracts were dried over
anhydrous magnesium sulfate and concentrated in vacuo to yield the title
compound as a colorless oil (860 mg, 5.40 mmol, 91%) that was used
without further purification. 4-(tert-butylthio)but-2-yn-1-ol,Yield (860
mg, 5.40 mmol, 91%). IR (film) 3360 (br), 2960, 2863, 1459, 1364, 1236,
1162, 1135, 1009, 701 cm−1; 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) δ 4.28 (dt, 2H, J =
6.1, 2.1 Hz, CH2OH), 3.32 (t, 2H, J = 2.1 Hz, CH2S), 1.55 (t, 1H, J = 6.1
Hz, OH), 1.38 (s, 9H, C(CH3)3); 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3) δ 83.3, 80.3,
51.4, 43.3, 30.7, 17.0; HRMS (ESI) exact mass calculated for [M+H]+
(C8H15OS) requires m/z 159.0844, found m/z 159.0839.

$DATUM 31-026-CAS-15119260
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 91
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 157141-27-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 12125-02-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
(3S,5R,6S)-3-Ally5-(3-chlorophenyl)-6-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-methy1-((S)-1-(((trimethylsilyl)methyl)thio)butan-2-yl)-piperidin-2-one
(60). To a solution of 55 (125 mg, 0.280 mmol) in toluene (1 mL) was
added cyanomethylenetributylphosphorane (300 μL, 1.12 mmol) and
(trimethylsilyl)methanethiol (150 μL 1.12 mol) at 25 °C. The mixture was
heated to 110 °C for 2 h. The reaction was cooled down to rt, quenched
(satd NH4Cl), extracted (2 x EtOAc), and washed (brine). The combined
organic layers were dried over Na2SO4 and filtered, and the filtrate was
concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash
column chromatography (SiO2, 10, 20, 40% EtOAc/hexanes) to provide 60.
Compounds 26, 28−33, 35, 38, and 40, were prepared from 55−57, and 61−64,
respectively, according to a similar procedure described for the
synthesis of 20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Mitsunobu reaction

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
(3S,5R,6S)-3-Ally5-(3-chlorophenyl)-6-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-methy1-((S)-1-(((trimethylsilyl)methyl)thio)butan-2-yl)-piperidin-2-one
(60). To a solution of 55 (125 mg, 0.280 mmol) in toluene (1 mL) was
added cyanomethylenetributylphosphorane (300 μL, 1.12 mmol) and
(trimethylsilyl)methanethiol (150 μL 1.12 mol) at 25 °C. The mixture was
heated to 110 °C for 2 h. The reaction was cooled down to rt, quenched
(satd NH4Cl), extracted (2 x EtOAc), and washed (brine). The combined
organic layers were dried over Na2SO4 and filtered, and the filtrate was
concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue was purified by flash
column chromatography (SiO2, 10, 20, 40% EtOAc/hexanes) to provide 60.
Compounds 26, 28−33, 35, 38, and 40, were prepared from 55−57, and 61−64,
respectively, according to a similar procedure described for the
synthesis of 20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM [3-(4-Cyano-phenyl)-4,5-dihydro-isoxazol-5-yl]-thioacetic acid ethyl
ester[13] (7) To a solution of racemic
[3-(4-cyano-phenyl)-4,5-dihydro-isoxazol-5-yl]acetic acid (21.2 g; 92
mmol) and ethanethiol (10.2 mL; 137 mmol) in EtOAc (200 mL) and DMF (5
mL), a solution of DCC (20.86 g; 101 mmol) in EtOAc (50 mL) was added at
0°C. After 10 min, DMAP (1.59 g; 13 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture
was stirred at 0°C for 30 min, and then the ice bath was removed. The
reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 16 h. The reaction
mixture was kept in the freezer at - 5°C for 1 h. The DCU was filtered
off. The filtrate was washed with water (2 x 50 mL). It was dried over
anhydrous Na2SO4 Solvent was removed. The residue was purified by flash
chromatography with 10-20% EtOAc in light petroleum. It was crystallized
from EtOAc and light petroleum to give 23 g (91.2%).
[3-(4-Cyano-phenyl)-4,5-dihydro-isoxazol-5-yl]-thioacetic acid ethyl
ester[13] (7), yield 23 g (91.2%). mp 92-94°C. All other physicochemical
data agreed with reported values.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
2-(1-Amino-isoquinolin-6-ylamino)-7-ethanesulfonyl-4,11-diaza-tricyclo[14.2.2.16,10]henicosa-1(19),6,8,10(21),16(20),17-hexaene-3,12-dione
trifluoroacetic acid salt. 6A: 2-(Ethylsulfonyl)-5-nitrobenzonitrile.
Ethanethiol (2.8 mL, 38 mmol) was added to a solution of
2-fluoro-5-nitrobenzonitrile (5.00 g, 30.1 mmol) and triethylamine (9.3
mL, 67 mmol) in DMF(100 mL). The reaction mixture was stirred for 1 h and
then poured into water (500 mL). The resulting precipitate was isolated
by filtration, dissolved in DCM, washed with water and brine, dried
(MgSO4), and concentrated under reduced pressure. The residue (6.14 g)
was dissolved in DCM (100 mL), cooled to 0°C, and treated with MCPBA
(16.0 g, 71 mmol) in one portion. The reaction mixture was allowed to
stir at rt overnight, and then was extracted with sodium bicarbonate
solution (saturated), sodium bisulfitesolution (10%), and brine. The
organic layer was dried (MgSO4) and concentrated under reduced pressureto
afford 6A (5.6 g, 80%) as a pale yellow solid.
(R)-2-(1-Amino-isoquinolin-6-ylamino)-7-(propane-2-sulfonyl)-4,11-diaza-tricyclo[14.2.2.16,10]henicosa-1(19),6,8,10(21),16(20),17-hexaene-3,12-dione.
9A: 2-(Isopropylsulfonyl)-5-nitrobenzonitrile. Using a procedure
analogous to that used to prepare 6A, 2-fluoro-5-nitrobenzonitrile (2.50
g, 15.6 mmol) was reacted with isopropylthiol and oxidized with mCPBA to
afford 9A (3.04 g, 91%) as a white solid. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 1.40
(d,J=7.03 Hz, 6 H), 3.55-3.76 (m, 1H), 8.38 (d,J=8.35 Hz,1H), 8.63
(dd,J=8.79, 2.20 Hz,1H), 8.74 (d, J=2.64 Hz, 1H)

inhibitors useful as anticoagulants and their preparation

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-(2-Hydroxy-4-methoxyphenyl)-3,3-bis(methylthio)-2-phenyl-2-propen-1-one
(6f): To a stirred mixture of a
1-(2-hydroxy-4-methoxyphenyl)-2-phenylethanone (0.121 g, 0.5 mmol),
carbon disulfide (0.3 mL, 5.0 mmol), iodomethane (0.06 mL, 2.4 mmol), and
tetrabutylammonium hydrogensulfate (17 mg, 0.05 mmol) in THF (1.5 mL) and
water (1 mL) was slowly added 10 M solution of NaOH in water (0.6 mL, 6
mmol) at 0 degC. The resulting mixture was vigorously stirred at 0 degC
for 5 min, and the product was extracted with ethyl acetate (2 x 10 mL).
The combined organic layer was washed with water (10 mL) and then with
brine (10 mL), dried over MgSO4, and filtered. The filtrate was
concentrated under reduced pressure, and the residue was purified by
silica gel column chromatography (eluting with EtOAc/hexane=1/4) to yield
0.158 g (91 %) of the title compound as a yellow gel.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reactions of tetrachlorophthalonitrile with
thiols (general procedure). Tetrachlorophthalonitrile (I), 1.33 g, and a
required amount (0.005, 0.010, 0.015, or 0.020 mol) of the corresponding
thiol were dispersed in 20 ml of DMF, and an equimolar amount of
triethylamine (with respect to the thiol) was added dropwise under
stirring at room temperature. The mixture gradually turned brown, and a
white solid separated. The mixture was stirred for 1 h, poured into 5%
hydrochloric acid, and extracted with benzene (or the precipitate was
filtered off and dissolved in benzene), and the products were separated
by column chromatography on silica gel using benzene as eluent or were
purified by recrystallization. Compound VII. Yield: 91%. mp, °C: 146-148
(From ethanol), VII: 13C NMR spectrum, (In DMSO-d6), δC, ppm: 150.3
(CArS), 144.4 (CAr-Cl), 116.0 (CAr-CN), 114.5 (C≡N), 56.1 (C-CH3), 55.7
(C-CH3), 32.2 (CH3), 32.1 (CH3), 31.9 (CH3). 1H NMR spectrum, δ, ppm:
1.27-1.36 m (9H), 1.42-1.38 m (9H). IR spectra: (2231, νCN cm-1). Found,
%, C: 51.46, 51.53, H: 4.90, 4.93, Cl: 18.72, 18.81, N: 7.50, 7.58, S:
17.26 17.35, Formula: C16H18Cl2N2S2. Calculated, %, C: 51.47, H: 4.86,
Cl: 18.99, N: 7.50, S: 17.18, M+: 372.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, 2 equiv RSH

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Preparation of
Hetero-1,4-naphthoquinones. Equimolar amounts of
2,3-dichloro-1,4-naphthoquinone 1 or monosubstituted naphthoquinone
derivatives 3, 7, and N- or S-nucleophilic compounds 2a-i, 4a-b, and
10a-c in abs. EtOH (50 mL) were stirred at different temperatures using
base, where required. The color of the solution quickly changed and the
extent of the reaction was monitored by TLC. CHCl3 (30 mL) was added to
the reaction mixture. The organic layer was separated and washed with
water (4 x 30 mL), and dried with Na2SO4. The resulting solution was
concentrated in vacuo and the residue was subjected to column
chromatography on silica gel using suitable solvents.Compound 5a was
synthesized from 0.20 g (0.704 mmol)
2-chloro-3-(phenylamino)naphthalene-1,4-dione 3a and 0.182 g (0.704 mmol)
hexadecanethiol 4a using triethylamine as base according to the general
procedure. Compound 6c was synthesized by the reaction of 0.1 g (0.316
mmol) 2-(4-fluorobenzylamino)-3-chloronaphthalene-1,4-dione 3c with 0.09
g (0.316 mmol) octadecanthiol 4b and using Na2CO3 as base according to
the general procedure. Compound 6c as red color, yield 91%. m.p. 86-87°C.
IR (KBr): ν = 3308 (N-H), 3053(C-Harom.), 2912, 2849 (C-Haliph.), 1669
(C=O), 1591,1551(C=C). -1H-NMR (499.74 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 0.79-0.82 (t, 3H,
J= 6.83 Hz, CH3), 1.10-1.26, 1.40-1.51 (m, 32H, CH2), 2.67-2.69(t, 2H, J=
7.32 Hz,S-CH2), 5.01-5.02 (d, 2H, J= 5.86 Hz,NHCH2), 6.96-7.00 (m, 2H,
CHarom), 7.19-7.24 (m, 2H, Hz, CHarom), 6.55 (t, 1H, J= 5.86 Hz, NH),
7.52(t, 1H, J= 7.57 Hz, CHnapht), 7.65 (t, 1H, J= 7.57 Hz, CHnapht),
7.94(d, 1H, J= 7.49 Hz, CHnapht), 8.07 (d, 1H, J= 7.49 Hz, CHnapht).
-13C-NMR (125.66 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 14.3 (-CH3), 22.9, 29.1, 29.8, 30.1,
32.1 (-CH2-), 35.4(SCH2-), 49.4(NH-CH2), 115.9, 129.4 (CHarom), 131.0
(S-Cnapht), 134.8 (-NH-Cnapht), 126.7, 126.9, 132.1, 132.4 (CHnapht),
133.1, 133.9(Cnapht), 134.3 (Carom),160.3-162.3 (d, F-Carom), 180.4,
181.5(C=O). -MS (+ESI): m/z = 566[M]+, C35H48FNO2S, (565.82). Calcd., %:
C 74.29; H 8.55; N 2.48; S 5.67 Found, %: C 74.37; H 9.27; N 2.69; S
5.45.

derivatives 3, 7, and N- or S-nucleophilic compounds 2a-i, 4a-b, and

the reaction mixture. The organic layer was separated and washed with

concentrated in vacuo and the residue was subjected to column
chromatography on silica gel using suitable solvents.Compound 5a was
synthesized from 0.20 g (0.704 mmol)

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Preparation of
Hetero-1,4-naphthoquinones. Equimolar amounts of
2,3-dichloro-1,4-naphthoquinone 1 or monosubstituted naphthoquinone
derivatives 3, 7, and N- or S-nucleophilic compounds 2a-i, 4a-b, and
10a-c in abs. EtOH (50 mL) were stirred at different temperatures using
base, where required. The color of the solution quickly changed and the
extent of the reaction was monitored by TLC. CHCl3 (30 mL) was added to
the reaction mixture. The organic layer was separated and washed with
water (4 x 30 mL), and dried with Na2SO4. The resulting solution was
concentrated in vacuo and the residue was subjected to column
chromatography on silica gel using suitable solvents.Compound 5a was
synthesized from 0.20 g (0.704 mmol)
2-chloro-3-(phenylamino)naphthalene-1,4-dione 3a and 0.182 g (0.704 mmol)
hexadecanethiol 4a using triethylamine as base according to the general
procedure. Compound 5c was synthesized by the reaction of 0.2 g (0.633
mmol) 2-(4-fluorobenzylamino)-3-chloronaphthalene-1,4-dione 3c with 0.163
g (0.633 mmol) hexadecanthiol 4a and using Na2CO3 as base according to
the general procedure. Compound 5c as red color, yield 91%. m.p. 81-82°C.
IR (KBr): ν = 3306 (N-H), 3052 (C-Harom.), 2913, 2849 (C-Haliph.), 1669
(C=O), 1551-1503 (C=C).-1H-NMR (499.74 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 0.79-0.82 (t, 3H,
J= 6.84 Hz, CH3), 1.10-1.26, 1.40-1.52 (m, 28H, CH2), 2.67-2.70 (t, 2H,
J= 7.32 Hz,S-CH2), 5.01-5.02 (d, 2H, J= 5.85 Hz,NHCH2), 6.96-7.00 (m, 2H,
CHarom), 7.18-7.23 (m, 2H, Hz, CHarom), 6.55 (t, 1H, J= 5.87 Hz, NH),
7.51 (t, 1H, J= 7.57 Hz, CHnapht), 7.65 (t, 1H, J= 7.57 Hz, CHnapht),
7.93 (d, 1H, J= 7.56 Hz, CHnapht), 8.06 (d, 1H, J= 7.56 Hz,
CHnapht).-13C-NMR (125.66 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 13.0 (-CH3), 21.6, 27.6, 28.3,
28.7, 30.9 (-CH2-), 34.1 (SCH2-), 48.1 (NH-CH2), 114.7, 128.2 (CHarom),
129.3 (S-Cnapht), 133.7 (-NH-Cnapht), 125.4, 125.6, 131.1, 131.2
(CHnapht), 132.7, 133.0(Cnapht), 133.2 (Carom),160.3-162.3 (d, F-Carom),
179.3, 179.9(C=O).-MS (+ESI): m/z = 538[M]+, C33H44FNO2S, (537.77).
Calcd., %: C 73.70; H 8.25; N 2.60; S 5.96 Found, %: C 74.52; H 8.43; N
2.68; S 5.74.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Preparation of
Hetero-1,4-naphthoquinones. Equimolar amounts of
2,3-dichloro-1,4-naphthoquinone 1 or monosubstituted naphthoquinone
derivatives 3, 7, and N- or S-nucleophilic compounds 2a-i, 4a-b, and
10a-c in abs. EtOH (50 mL) were stirred at different temperatures using
base, where required. The color of the solution quickly changed and the
extent of the reaction was monitored by TLC. CHCl3 (30 mL) was added to
the reaction mixture. The organic layer was separated and washed with
water (4 x 30 mL), and dried with Na2SO4. The resulting solution was
concentrated in vacuo and the residue was subjected to column
chromatography on silica gel using suitable solvents.Compound 5a was
synthesized from 0.20 g (0.704 mmol)
2-chloro-3-(phenylamino)naphthalene-1,4-dione 3a and 0.182 g (0.704 mmol)
hexadecanethiol 4a using triethylamine as base according to the general
procedure. Compound 5e was synthesized by the reaction of 0.1 g (0.335
mmol) 2-(o-tolylamino)-3-chloronaphthalene-1,4-dione 3e with 0.086 g
(0.335 mmol) hexadecanthiol 4a and using Na2CO3 as base according to the
general procedure. Compound 5e as dark blue color, yield 91%. m.p.
79-80°C. IR (KBr): ν = 3304 (N-H), 3050 (C-Harom.), 2916, 2849
(C-Haliph.), 1664, 1633 (C=O), 1587, 1552 (C=C).-1H-NMR (499.74 MHz,
CDCl3): δ = 0.80-0.83 (t, 3H, J= 6.83 Hz, CH3), 1.09-1.35, 1.46-1.54 (m,
28H, CH2), 2.26 (s, 3H, CH3arom), 2.51-2.54 (t, 2H, J= 7.32 Hz, S-CH2),
6.83-6.85 (d, 1H, J= 7.81 Hz, CHarom), 7.04-7.12 (m, 2H, CHarom),
7.13-7.16 (d, 1H, J= 6.83 Hz, CHarom), 7.52 (bs, 1H, NH), 7.56 (t, 1H, J=
7.57 Hz, CHnapht), 7.67 (t, 1H, J= 7.57 Hz, CHnapht), 7.98 (d, 1H, J=
7.81 Hz, CHnapht), 8.08 (d, 1H, J= 7.81 Hz, CHnapht).-13C-NMR (125.66
MHz, CDCl3): δ = 13.1 (-CH3), 17.3 (-CH3arom), 22.7, 28.3, 28.6, 29.3,
31.9 (-CH2-), 33.7 (SCH2-), 115.4, 124.9, 129.3, 129.8, (CHarom), 123.1
(S-Cnapht), 124.6 (-NH-Cnapht), 125.5, 125.8, 130.8,132.6 (CHnapht),
131.5 (Carom), 133.4, 136.6 (Cnapht), 145.6 (NH-C), 179.4, 179.7(C=O).-MS
(+ESI): m/z = 520 [M]+, C33H45NO2S, (519.78).Calcd., %: C 76.25; H 8.73;
N 2.69; S 6.17 Found, %: C 76.49; H 9.68; N 2.60; S 6.02.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: (Z)-(tert-Butylsulfanyl)(aryl)diazenes[or
(Z)-tert-Butyl Aryl Diazosulfides] 3a-r
(Z)-(tert-Butylsulfanyl)(2-fluorophenyl)diazene (3f); Representative
Procedure According to the procedure previously reported 1 for the
preparation of (Z)-(tert-butylsulfanyl)(phenyl)diazene (3a),
2-fluorobenzenediazonium o-benzenedisulfonimide (1, Ar = 2-FC6H4) (3.41
g, 10 mmol) was added in one portion with vigorous stirring, to a soln of
sodium 2-methylpropan-2-thiolate, prepared from 2-methylpropan-2-thiol
(2) (0.99 g, 11 mmol) and sodium methoxide (30% soln in MeOH; 2.00 g, 11
mmol) in anhyd MeOH (20 mL), at r.t. (20-25 °C). The salt dissolved at
once and a yellow-orange soln was obtained. No evolution of nitrogen was
observed. Stirring was maintained until a test of azocoupling with
2-naphthol was negative (10 min). The reaction mixture was poured into
Et2O-sat. aq NaCl (200 mL, 1:1). The aq soln was separated and extracted
with Et2O (100 mL). The combined organic extracts were washed with sat.
aq NaCl (2 × 100 mL), dried (Na2SO4), and evaporated under reduced
pressure. Compound 3n, Yield: 91%, oil. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ (ppm), J (Hz):
1.60 (s, 9 H), 6.92-7.00, 7.11-7.35 (2 m, 1:2, 3 H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM safety (- reactant is a potentially explosive diazonium salt),
stereoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A general procedure to selectively prepare N-alkylanilines by an
unexpected reaction of (Z)-(tert-butylsulfanyl)(aryl)diazenes with
alkyllithium reagents
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Barbero, Margherita; Degani, Iacopo; Dughera, Stefano; Fochi, Rita
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2003), (5), 742-750

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM (S)-1,2-O-(1-Ethylthioethylidene)-α-D-xylopyranose (4). In a 500 mL round
bottom flask acetobromoxylose (2, 30.91 g, 91.1 mmol),[21,22] was
dissolved in anhydrous, aceto nitrile (100 mL) under argon. Then
sym-collidine (15.6m L, 117.4 m mol) and tetra-butylammonium bromide
(2.97 g, 9.1 mmol) were added. The round bottom flask was closed with a
septum and an argon filled balloon was attached. Ethanethiol (11.2m L,
151 mmol) was added via a syringe, and the reaction mixture was stirred
overnight at RT until TLC (PE/EA1:1, R f (2) = 0.44) showed complete
conversion of the starting material. The solvent was removed under
reduced pressure, and the remainder was coevaporated four times with
toluene, dissolved in diethylether and washed seven times with water to
remove collidiniumhydrobromide. The slightly yellow syrup was dissolved
in anhydrous, methanol (120 mL), and a 1M methanolic sodium methanolate
solution (3.0mL, 3 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred for
10 min at RT until TLC showed complete conversion of the starting
material. The solvent was evaporated and the remainder was coevaporated
with toluene. After crystallization from toluene (no heating!) at-3 0 °C
compound 4 (1 9.6 4 g, 83.1 mmol, 91%) was obtained as pure
exo-derivative. Colorless needles. mp: 67.5-68.5°C; [α]D 20 = + 46.5 (c =
0.4, MeOH); TLC (PE/EA 1 :1 + 1% pyridine): R f = 0.36 (H2SO4); 1H NMR
(400MHz, CDCl3): δ exo = 5.55 (d, 1H, H-1, 3 J 1,2 = 3.6Hz), 4.26 (d d ~
t, 1H, H-2, J 1,2 = 3.6H z), 4.03 (m, 1H, H-3), 3.91 (dd, 1H, H-5a, 3 J
4,5a = 6.4, J 5a,b = 14.0 Hz), 3.72-3.64 (m, 2H, H-4, H-5b), 3.56 (bs,
2H, 3-OH, 4-OH), 2.65 (q, 2H, SCH2CH3, J = 7.4 Hz), 1.95 (s, 3H,
CH3C(SEt)OR2), 1.26 (t, 3H, SCH2CH3, 3 J = 7.4 Hz) ppm; 13C NMR
(100.67MHz, CDCl3): δ exo= 116.79 (CH3C[OR]2Etexo), 97.28 (C-1), 77.06,
79.85, 68.01 (C-2, C-3, C-4), 63.67 (C-5), 28.88 (endo-CH3C[OR]2 SEtexo),
24.78 (SCH2CH3), 15.00 (SCH2CH3) ppm.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM (E)-1-Alkylthio-2-p-tolylsulphonylstilbenes (3a-i)-General Procedure A
solution of sodium alkanethiolate prepared by adding an appropriate
alkanethiol (6 mmoI) to a solution of sodium (6 mg atom) in abs. ethanol
(25 ml) was added to a solution of 1 (6 m mol) dissolved in abs. ethanol
(75 mI). The reaction mixture was heated under reflux. Refluxion time
varied from 5 to 7 h in different cases. In many cases, the solution upon
cooling deposited the sulphide-suIphones, (3) which were recrystallized
from an appropriate solvent. (E)-1-methylthio-2-p-tolylsulphonylstilbene
(3a) Recrystallized from aqueous ethanol as shining needles, yield 91% m.
p. 172-173°C, (Found: C, 69.13; H, 5.25; S, 16.61. C22H20O2S2 requires C,
69.44; H, 5.30; S, 16.82%). EIMS: m/z (reI. int.%) 380(37), 333(8),
269(15), 259(12), 226(14), 225(19), 210(42), 179(15), 178(100), 176(8),
155(15), 139(5), 138(6), 126(5), 123(9), 121(22), 105(19), 91(21), and
78(11).

$DATUM 64-17-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 6-(tert-Butylthio)nicotinonitrile: Add sodium ethoxide (12 mL of 21% w/v
in ethanol, 36 mmol) to a solution of 2-methyl-2-propanethiol (4.06 mL,
36 mmol) in anhydrous ethanol (90 mL) at 0°C under nitrogen atmosphere.
Stir the solution and allow it to warm to room temperature over 30 min.
Add 6-chloronicotinonitrile (5 g, 36 mmol) and then heat the reaction to
reflux overnight. Cool to room temperature, add saturated aqueous NaHCO3
and concentrate in vacuo. Extract into EtOAc or dichloromethane and wash
with brine. Dry over MgSO4 and concentrate in vacuo to give the desired
intermediate as orange crystals (6.31 g, 91%).
6-(tert-Butylthio)nicotinonitrile. Yield (6.31 g, 91%). MS (ES+) m/z 193
(M+H)+.

$DATUM (1'R,2S)-5-Benzyloxymethyl-2-[1'-(2-methoxyethoxymethoxy)
ethyl]-5-hexenoic Acid S-Ethyl Ester (21). To a solution of acid 18

0.130 mmol), ethanethiol (0.31 mL, 4.145 mmol), and DCC (0.530 g, 2.573
mmol) at 0 °C. The reaction mixture was stirred for 3 h at room
temperature. Precipitated DCU was filtered off, and the filtrate was
